example_3: so sabbaso rāg'ānusayaṃ pahāya paṭigh'ānusayaṃ paṭivinodetvā asmī'ti diṭṭhimān'ānusayaṃ samūhanitvā avijjaṃ pahāya vijjaṃ uppādetvā diṭṭh'eva dhamme dukkhass'antakaro hoti
example_4: yo ca sameti pāpāni, aṇuṃ thūlāni sabbaso. samitattā hi pāpānaṃ, samaṇo'ti pavuccati.

meaning: all that is felt; all that is experienced; all feeling
example_1: tassa idh'eva, bhikkhave, sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sīti bhavissanti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, anupādisesā nibbānadhātu. imā kho, bhikkhave, dve nibbānadhātuyo'ti.
example_2: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.

meaning: leading to samadhi; conducive to mental composure
example_1: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṃvattanikāni.

meaning: destined for full awakening; culminating in enlightenment
example_1: santi, bhikkhave, bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sot'āpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyanā, evarūpā'pi, bhikkhave, santi bhikkhū imasmiṃ bhikkhusaṅghe.

meaning: forcibly; quickly; suddenly; all of a sudden
example_1: ukkoṭanavañcananikatisāciyogā paṭivirato hoti, chedanavadhabandhanaviparāmosaālopasahasākārā paṭivirato hoti
example_2: atha kho so, bhikkhave, mudumūsi gocarāya pakkāmi. tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā saṅkhāditvā ajjhohari. tassa so mudumūsi antam'pi khādi, antaguṇam'pi khādi.
example_3: ye nāgarāje sahasā haranti, dibbā dijā pakkhi visuddhacakkhū, vehāsayā te vanamajjhapattā, citrā supaṇṇā iti tesa nāmaṃ.
example_4: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.

meaning: going the right way; following the proper course
example_1: yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathāgataṃ sakkaroti garuṃ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati paramāya pūjāya
example_2: na tāv'āhaṃ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti … dhamm'ānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo

example_1: yāni ca kho tāni sen'āsanāni appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhaseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni tathārūpehi sen'āsanehi saṃsaggaṃ vaṇṇayāmī'ti
example_2: yāni ca kho tāni sikkhāpadāni ādibrahmacariyakāni brahmacariyasāruppāni tattha dhuvasīlo ca hoti ṭhitasīlo ca, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
example_3: yaṃnūn'āhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyan'ti.
example_4: sabbamaññitasamugghātasāruppaṃ vo, bhikkhave, paṭipadaṃ desessāmi.

example_1: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ
example_2: yo ca sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca, tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati, karaṃ purisakiccāni, so sukhā na vihāyati.
example_3: katame ca, bhikkhave, āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā? idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso khamo hoti sītassa uṇhassa, jighacchāya pipāsāya

meaning: becomes cool; grows cold; cools down
example_1: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā uddhaṃ jīvitapariyādānā idh'eva sabbavedayitāni anabhinanditāni sītībhavissantī'ti pajānāti.
bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, lok'ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ
example_2: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca, yam'idaṃ, bho gotama, dāne puññañ'ca puññamahī ca taṃ dāyakānaṃ sukhāya hotū'ti.

meaning: gone the right way; practised well
example_1: ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā ... rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā. ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.
example_2: saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti, suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho.
example_3: ayaṃ gaṇo suppaṭipanno'ti sayaṃ samattaṃ karoti paripuṇṇaṃ karoti anomaṃ karoti aggaṃ seṭṭhaṃ visiṭṭhaṃ pāmokkhaṃ uttamaṃ pavaraṃ karoti.

example_1: na saṅkittīsu na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṃ na maṃsaṃ na suraṃ na merayaṃ na thus'odakaṃ pivanti.
example_2: surāmerayapānañ'ca, yo naro anuyuñjati. idh'eva'm'eso lokasmiṃ, mūlaṃ khaṇati attano.

meaning: distilled and fermented liquor, drugs and states of intoxication
example_1: idha, visākhe, mātugāmo pāṇ'ātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinn'ādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.

meaning: grief, wailing, pain, suffering and trouble
example_1: jāti'pi dukkhā, jarā'pi dukkhā, maraṇam'pi dukkhaṃ, soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass'upāyāsā'pi dukkhā
example_2: piyānaṃ kho, nāgita, vipariṇām'aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass'upāyāsā, eso tassa nissando.
example_3: taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṃ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṃ soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass'upāyāsā sambhavanti

example_2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami
example_3: āyuṃ arogiyaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ, ratiyo patthayantena, uḷārā apar'āparā.
example_4: tesaṃ taṃ vaṇṇāya c'eva hoti balāya ca, na ca tatonidānaṃ maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ.

meaning: with beautiful colour; good-looking; delightful in appearance
example_1: seyyathā'pi, sunakkhatta, āpānīyakaṃso vaṇṇasampanno gandhasampanno rasasampanno, so ca kho visena saṃsaṭṭho.

meaning: elements; wind and heat; wind and sun
example_1: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso cīvaraṃ paṭisevāmi yāva'd'eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsamakasavāt'ātapasiriṃsapasamphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva'd'eva hirikopīnapaṭicchādan'atthaṃ
example_2: mā ca vāt'ātape cārittaṃ anuyuñji, mā te vāt'ātape cārittaṃ anuyuttassa rajosūkaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ anuddhaṃsesi. vaṇānurakkhī ca, ambho purisa, vihareyyāsi vaṇasāropī'ti.
example_3: sītañ'ca uṇhañ'ca khudaṃ pipāsaṃ, vāt'ātape ḍaṃsasarīsape ca. sabbāni'p'etāni abhisambhavitvā, eko care khaggavisāṇakappo.

meaning: arising of understanding; birth of wisdom; appearance of knowledge
example_1: kathaṃ pan'āvuso, āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti na hotī'ti? avijjāvirāgā kho, āvuso, vijj'uppādā taṇhānirodhā, evaṃ āyatiṃ punabbhav'ābhinibbatti na hotī'ti.
example_2: idh'assa, vappa, kāyena saṃvuto vācāya saṃvuto manasā saṃvuto avijjāvirāgā vijj'uppādā. passasi no tvaṃ, vappa, taṃ ṭhānaṃ yatonidānaṃ purisaṃ dukkhavedaniyā āsavā assaveyyuṃ abhisamparāyan'ti?
example_3: tassa avijjāvirāgā vijj'uppādā asmī'ti'pi'ssa na hoti, ayam'aham'asmī'ti'pi'ssa na hoti

meaning: dependent on consciousness; due to consciousness
example_1: avijjāpaccayā, saṅkhārā, saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṃ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷ'āyatanaṃ, saḷ'āyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā
example_2: etam'ādīnavaṃ ñatvā, dukkhaṃ viññāṇapaccayā, viññāṇ'ūpasamā bhikkhu, nicchāto parinibbuto'ti.

example_2: taṃ kiṃ maññatha, kālāmā, ime dhammā kusalā vā akusalā vā'ti? akusalā, bhante. sāvajjā vā anavajjā vā'ti? sāvajjā, bhante. viññugarahitā vā viññuppasatthā vā'ti? viññugarahitā, bhante.

example_1: uposathakaraṇato pubbe navavidhaṃ pubbakiccaṃ kātabbaṃ hoti
example_2: vibhūtarūpasaññissa, sabbakāyappahāyino, ajjhattañ'ca bahiddhā ca, n'atthi kiñcī'ti passato, ñāṇaṃ sakk'ānupucchāmi, kathaṃ neyyo tathāvidho.
example_3: satt'ime kāyā akaṭā akaṭavidhā animmitā animmātā vañjhā kūṭaṭṭhā esikaṭṭhāyiṭṭhitā, te na iñjanti na vipariṇamanti na aññam'aññaṃ byābādhenti n'ālaṃ aññam'aññassa sukhāya vā dukkhāya vā sukhadukkhāya vā.

example_2: na hi verena verāni, sammant'īdha kudācanaṃ, averena ca sammanti, esa dhammo sanantano.
example_3: akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ, ajini maṃ ahāsi me, ye ca taṃ upanayhanti, veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.
example_4: jayaṃ veraṃ pasavati, dukkhaṃ seti parājito, upasanto sukhaṃ seti, hitvā jayaparājayaṃ.

meaning: to you all; for you all
example_1: yo vo … mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam'accayena satthā.
example_2: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññ'āgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād'attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī'ti.
example_3: alañ'hi vo, kālāmā, kaṅkhituṃ alaṃ vicikicchituṃ
example_4: tesaṃ vo, bhikkhave, evaṃsamaññānaṃ sataṃ evaṃpaṭiññānaṃ sataṃ, yā samaṇasāmīcippaṭipadā taṃ paṭipajjissāma. evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ samaññā ca saccā bhavissati paṭiññā ca bhūtā.
